intro: Rhynchosia sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flowered legume, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in a hairy, pod-like structure that splits open when mature. Rhynchosia sessiliflora is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
